official-title.#text:
To reauthorize the National Windstorm Impact Reduction
		  Program, and for other purposes.

Committee on Science, Space, and
			 Technology

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by
			 the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within

short-title.#text:
National Windstorm Impact Reduction
			 Act Reauthorization of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

quote.#text: Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the National Institute of Standards and
			 Technology

Section 203(1) of the National Windstorm
			 Impact Reduction Act of 2004
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:203/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 204 of the
			 National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:204
National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:204/ss:a
National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:204/ss:b
National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:204/ss:c

text.#text:
There is established the National Windstorm
				Impact Reduction Program, the purpose of which is to achieve major measurable
				reductions in the losses of life and property from windstorms through a
				coordinated Federal effort, in cooperation with other levels of government,
				academia, and the private sector, aimed at improving the understanding of
				windstorms and their impacts and developing and encouraging the implementation
				of cost-effective mitigation measures to reduce those impacts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall have the primary responsibility for planning
				and coordinating the Program. In carrying out this paragraph, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National Institute
				of Standards and Technology

text.#text:
ensure that the
				Program includes the necessary components to promote the implementation of
				windstorm risk reduction measures by Federal, State, and local governments,
				national standards and model building code organizations, architects and
				engineers, and others with a role in planning and constructing buildings and
				lifelines;

support the
				development of performance-based engineering tools, and work with appropriate
				groups to promote the commercial application of such tools, including through
				wind-related model building codes, voluntary standards, and construction best
				practices;

coordinate all
				Federal post-windstorm investigations; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the use of such
				recommendations.

text.#text:
when warranted by research or investigative
				findings, issue recommendations to assist in informing the development of model
				codes, and provide information to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:204/ss:b/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be responsible for carrying out research and
				development to improve model building codes, voluntary standards, and best
				practices for the design, construction, and retrofit of buildings, structures,
				and lifelines.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National Institute of
				Standards and Technology

text.#text:
In addition to the lead agency
				responsibilities described under

header.#text:
National
				Institute of Standards and Technology

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall support research
				in engineering and the atmospheric sciences to improve the understanding of the
				behavior of windstorms and their impact on buildings, structures, and
				lifelines.

shall support atmospheric sciences research to
				improve the understanding of the behavior of windstorms and their impact on
				buildings, structures, and lifelines.

shall support the development of risk assessment tools and effective
				mitigation techniques, windstorm-related data collection and analysis, public
				outreach, information dissemination, and implementation of mitigation measures
				consistent with the Agency’s all-hazards
				approach.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:204/ss:d
National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act of 2004/s:204/ss:c

				Policy

text.#text:
the head of any other Federal agency the

shall meet not less than 2
				times a year at the call of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Coordinating Committee on Windstorm Impact Reduction

Director of the National Institute of Standards
				and Technology

shall oversee the planning
				and coordination of the Program.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Coordinating Committee on Windstorm Impact Reduction

short-title.#tail:
, a Strategic Plan for the
				Program that includes—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National Windstorm Impact
				Reduction Act Reauthorization of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Windstorm Impact Reduction Act Reauthorization of 2013

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				develop and submit to Congress, not later than one year after the date of
				enactment of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Interagency Coordinating Committee on Windstorm Impact Reduction

text.#text:
prioritized goals for the Program that will
				mitigate against the loss of life and property from future windstorms;

short-term, mid-term, and long-term
				research objectives to achieve those goals;

a description of the role of each Program
				agency in achieving the prioritized goals;

the methods by which progress towards the
				goals will be assessed; and

an explanation of how the Program will
				foster the transfer of research results into outcomes, such as improved model
				building codes.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National Windstorm Impact
				Reduction Act Reauthorization of 2013

Interagency Coordinating Committee on Windstorm Impact Reduction

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the progress of the Program that includes—

text.#text:
Not later than 18 months after the date of
				enactment of the

a description of the activities funded

				prioritized goals and research objectives established in the Strategic Plan,
				and the budgets, per agency, for these activities;

the outcomes achieved by the Program for
				each of the goals identified in the Strategic Plan;

header.#text:
National Advisory
			 Committee on Windstorm Impact Reduction

National Advisory Committee on Windstorm
				Impact Reduction

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the National Institute of
				Standards and Technology

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, which shall be composed of at least 7 members, none of whom
				may be employees of the Federal Government, including representatives of
				research and academic institutions, industry standards development
				organizations, emergency management agencies, State and local government, and
				business communities who are qualified to provide advice on windstorm impact
				reduction and represent all related scientific, architectural, and engineering
				disciplines. The recommendations of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Advisory Committee on Windstorm Impact Reduction
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Advisory Committee on Windstorm
				Impact Reduction

shall be considered
				by Federal agencies in implementing the Program.

Advisory Committee on Windstorm Impact Reduction
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Advisory Committee on Windstorm Impact
				Reduction

text.#text:
trends and developments in the natural and
				engineering sciences and practices of windstorm impact mitigation;

the priorities of the Program’s Strategic
				Plan;
the coordination of the Program; and

any revisions to the Program which may be
				necessary.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
established under this section shall serve
				without compensation.
